description: Provision of additional storey at third floor level incorporating a mansard roof, part three storey rear extension; rear roof terrace at first floor level; external alterations including new windows and conversion of part-ground floor and upper floors into 7 self contained flats, change of use of basement and part-ground floor to a retail shop unit (A1) and use of part of ground floor as an office unit (A2/B1use).
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surface of the mansard roof shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards, unless otherwise agreed by the local planning authority, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of works. The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation.  Reason: To ensure access for all for future occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the details already submitted to the Council, no development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority an elevation drawing showing obscured glazing to the bathroom at first floor level to the rear of the site. A sample of the obscured glazing to be used for this window shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  Reason:  To protect the living conditions of potential occupiers of this residential unit in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans, details of access for people with disabilities, including an Access Statement, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced; and the approved scheme shall be implemented before first occupation of the development and thereafter be retained.  Reason: To ensure adequate provision for people with disabilities, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the first floor level screening measures as indicated on the approved drawing ref: 625/RDP/P02B-2 received 15/7/2006, no development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority details and samples of alternate screening treatment. This condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  Reason:  To protect the visual appearance of the area in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the approved drawings, details of Security/Safety measures ( to comply with the aims and objectives of the Police requirements of Secured By Design), including external lighting and lockable and secure doors to the ground floor refuse storage areas and bicycle stand, shall be submitted in writing to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the development commencing. These works shall be carried out prior to the first occupation of the development, and permanently maintained thereafter retained permanently.   Reason: To ensure that the development achieves the required crime prevention elements and to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 4.4 and 4.12 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8: Safer Ealing. | Prior to the commencement of the development, details of the proposed hours of operation of the basement and part ground floor units shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the residential units and thereafter permanently retained.  Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of the building and nearby properties, in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No machinery, plant, openings or ducts shall be installed on any elevations without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of the building and nearby properties, in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the details already submitted to the Council, no development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, detailed drawings of the design and external appearance of the ground floor shopfronts, including the provision for disabled people to gain access to the premises. The details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation and permanently retained thereafter.  Reason: In the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and to ensure adequate access is provided for people with disabilities, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.3 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The two ground floor units shall only be used for an A2 (Financial and Professional Services)/B1 (Business) use and A1 (Shops) use respectively as shown on the approved drawings, and for no other purpose without planning permission first being obtained via the submission of a planning application to the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:  To restrict the use of the premises to one compatible with the surrounding area, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use in the interests of the living conditions of occupiers in the locality and highway safety, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the details already submitted to the Council, no development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, amendment drawings showing no outward opening doors at ground floor level. The details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation and permanently retained thereafter.  Reason: In the interests of the pedestrian safety and to ensure adequate access is provided for people with disabilities, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3, 5.5 and 9.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the details already submitted to the Council, no development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, full details of both hard and soft landscaping works for all external and roof terrace areas. These works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  Reason:  To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
